article.headline: BYU 72, Fresno St. 67
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. -- Jimmer Fredette had 24 points and seven assists as Brigham Young pulled away in the second half to defeat Fresno State 72-67 on Saturday night. Tyler Haws added 17 points for BYU (8-1), which won its third straight nonconference game. Greg Smith had 21 points and eight rebounds for Fresno State (4-5), including a 3-pointer with 5:12 left that brought the Bulldogs within eight points. BYU didn't allow Fresno State to get any closer until the final seconds. The Cougars finished 10 of 27 from 3-point range. Fredette and Jonathan Tavernari sparked a 14-2 Cougars run midway through the second half that turned a slim lead into a 58-41 cushion.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
